p.k: Matsu Také was created in 2002 and is dedicated to promoting Japanese music. The group musicians play a wide variety of Japanese instruments: Koto (zither on a Japanese table with harp sounds), Shakuhachi (famous Japanese bamboo flute), Shinobué (small bamboo flute) and much more. The repertoire offered by these musicians includes classical pieces, well-known folk songs and contemporary pieces, among which the listener will recognize typical Japanese melodies.
